title: Simpsons movie
content:
The long-awaited movie version of The Simpsons has finally been given a release date: 27 July, 2007. The yellow-skinned family's big-screen debut was announced in a teaser trailer that ran ahead of US screenings of Ice Age 2: The Meltdown

The 25-second clip opens with an "S" that resembles Superman's insignia, then widens to reveal Homer slumped on the family couch in his underpants. "I forgot what I was supposed to say," he says.

The teaser, which was also broadcast on the Fox network on Sunday night, closes by announcing the US release date of the movie.

Rumours of a Simpsons silver screen adventure have been circulating for more than a decade. Two years ago, the animated sitcom's producers finally confirmed a film was in the works. But could a movie ever live up to the TV show?

"I can absolutely guarantee that this film will far exceed the wildest expectations of every Simpsons fan," said producer Al Jean. "Start lining up at the theatre now - preferably in costume." [url=http://www.ironmaiden.com][img]http://i11.photobucket.com/albums/a199/rorie1983/ironmaiden.jpg[/img][/url]

title: Re: Simpsons movie
content:
I just had a thought about the Simpsons movie today.

I bet it starts with a super-awesome remake of the TV show's intro, but ends with lots of Springfieldians cramming into a movie theatre instead of having just the Simpsons gather in front of their TV.

I also bet it has some CG and some live action in it.----------

title: Re: Simpsons movie
content:
OH boy, the new trailer is quite good too.

Moe: "In 2-D!"

Cut to: 2D Homer driving a cell-shaded 3D crane. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img]

Looks cool though. Futurama-styled 3D animation of inorganic objects with black outlines, I can tolerate. Shiny, shadey, texture-mapped, photoUNrealistic talking animals I cannot. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-moon.gif[/img] ----------

title: Re: Simpsons movie
content: I saw it at a midnight screening on opening day. Didn't find it all that impressive. It was certainly amusing and crazy, but not the best thing I've seen in the cinema all year.

title: agreed
content: I agree with Spleen. It was entertaining, it had its moments, and it was enjoyable... but it was certainly not the all-encompassing experience I was anticipating. At least Moe (my favorite character) got a few good lines.

title: Re: agreed
content:
Moe is great. He's pathetic, but not in a sad kind of way. Sort of like Milhouse. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img]

"I'm not a nerd! Nerds are smart."[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: agreed
content: As a movie it's less than impressive. It's a good, long Simpsons episode, though. I loved the Bart skateboarding segment. I'm probably the only one I know who still likes the newer episodes, so when everyone said it was the only decent thing to come out of the Simpsons in years, I guess I got my hopes up a little high.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]
